page.title: 01 THE HAMBLETON BLOCK
page.content: Our block is mostly farming land.There are quite a few different crops.There is barley which is used to make beer,sugar beet for making sugar,oats for making porridge,wheat for flour, oil seed rape for making margarine,and potatoes for making crisps.The soil in our block is sandy and is well drained. There is also a drift mine in our block and it is called Gascoigne Wood. The A63 runs through Hambleton.It goes from Leeds to Hull.There aren't many animals in our block but there are cows at Mr.Lister's farm.There is a wooded hill called the Hough.It is quite near Hambleton it is about 40 metres high. Some of Hambleton has quite old houses but some are new.There are 3 shops in Hambleton there is the fish+chip shop a wool shop called"Unique"and the village shop.
